items.title: How Trump’s Targeting of Immigrants With Legal Status Departs From the Norm
items.description: Mahmoud Khalil is just one of many people with legal or protected status detained and facing deportation.

items.title: Trump Is Backing Away From Police Reform. Here’s What That Means for 12 Places.
items.description: The administration appears set to end federal oversight of police, including agencies that have committed systemic civil rights violations.

items.title: Strength Behind Bars
items.description: News Inside Issue 19 honors women navigating the correctional system.

items.title: At My Texas Prison, Solitary Confinement All But Guarantees Sexual Exploitation by Guards
items.description: Prison journalist Kwaneta Harris on “the hole” at Lane Murray Unit: “It is not uncommon for guards to withhold food unless we take our shirts off.”

items.title: The Big Business of Bad Prison Food
items.description: A market analysis said the food service industry in U.S. prisons and jails is worth billions — and is forecasted to grow.
